diagrams.description: A flowchart showing the fundamental concepts and structure of History of Science.
diagrams.mermaid_code:
flowchart TD HOS[History of Science] --> Approaches[Historical Approaches] HOS --> Periods[Major Historical Periods] HOS --> Disciplines[Scientific Disciplines] HOS --> Revolutions[Scientific Revolutions] HOS --> Methods[Research Methods] HOS --> KeyFigures[Key Historical Figures] Approaches --> Internal[Internal History] Approaches --> External[External History] Approaches --> Social[Social History of Science] Approaches --> Cultural[Cultural Context] Periods --> Ancient[Ancient Science
Greek & Roman] Periods --> Medieval[Medieval Science
Islamic Golden Age] Periods --> Renaissance[Renaissance Science
Humanism & Observation] Periods --> ScientificRev[Scientific Revolution
17th Century] Periods --> Enlightenment[Enlightenment Science
18th Century] Periods --> Modern[Modern Science
19th-20th Century] Disciplines --> Physics[History of Physics] Disciplines --> Chemistry[History of Chemistry] Disciplines --> Biology[History of Biology] Disciplines --> Mathematics[History of Mathematics] Disciplines --> Astronomy[History of Astronomy] Revolutions --> Copernican[Copernican Revolution] Revolutions --> Darwinian[Darwinian Revolution] Revolutions --> Einsteinian[Einsteinian Revolution] Revolutions --> Quantum[Quantum Revolution] Methods --> Archival[Archival Research] Methods --> PrimarySources[Primary Source Analysis] Methods --> SecondarySources[Secondary Literature Review] Methods --> Biographical[Biographical Studies] KeyFigures --> Galileo[Galileo Galilei] KeyFigures --> Newton[Isaac Newton] KeyFigures --> Darwin[Charles Darwin] KeyFigures --> Einstein[Albert Einstein]
